solution.text:
By carefully observing the given figure we can identify
area of the shaded region= area(region A) + area(region B) + area(region C)+ area(region D)
area [A+c]= Area(PQRS)- [area (semicircle O'')+ area (semicircle O)]
Area of the square PQRS = \(side^2= _{{j*j}}_\)
area [A+C]=\(_{{j*j}}_-[\frac 12 \times \pi \times (\frac {SR}2)^2+ \frac 12 \times \pi \times (\frac {PQ}2)^2] \)
so area [A+C]=_{{trunc(4*j*j-pi_val*j*j,2)}}_
Similarly area [B+D]=Area(PQRS)- [area (semicircle O')+ area (semicircle O''')]
area[D+B]=_{{trunc(4*j*j-pi_val*j*j,2)}}_
therefore, area of the shaded region=area[A+B+C+D]
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(4*j*j-pi_val*j*j,2)}}_ + _{{trunc(4*j*j-pi_val*j*j,2)}}_=_{{trunc(2*(4*j*j-pi_val*j*j),2)}}_\)

content.text:
A square of side length=_{{2*j}}_cm, contains four semi-circles inside it
If their centres lie at the midmoint of the sides of the square, find the area of the shaded region
